details.title: Teaching from the Maggid
details.content: The Maggid of Mezritch taught: In the upper worlds, there are no letter shapes at all! Letters have form only when divine light enters physical garments. Shape represents how the Infinite contracts to enter finitude.

details.title: Above Letters
details.content: Letter shapes shouldn't apply to angels and the world of intellect. So why do Hebrew letters have specific forms? Because they represent how the upper lights clothe themselves within physical reality.

details.title: Ktav Ivri Explained
details.content: Rashi describes Ktav Ivri as the script used in amulets and protective writings, associated with angels. It was appropriate when only the spiritual worlds were refined. The physical world hadn't yet been elevated.

details.title: White Script (Ktav Libona'ah)
details.content: Another opinion calls the original 'white script.' The Kedushas Levi explains: white represents the upper worlds (intellect), while black represents the lower world (physical). Before Purim, only the 'white' realm was rectified.

details.content: Letter shapes represent how divine light functions within physical reality. Before Purim, physicality wasn't refinedâ€”so letters had a 'higher' form. After Purim, when nature itself was elevated, letters could take their true, refined form.

blocks.text: The Four Worlds Before and After Purim

blocks.title: The Opener of Seventy Gates
blocks.intro: The Gemara states: 'Petachyaâ€”this is Mordechai. And why was he called Petachya? Because he would open matters and knew seventy languages.' What does 'opening' have to do with languages?

items.content: Seventy Ministers: Every nation has a heavenly ×©×¨ (minister) who determines their script and language. The way a ×©×¨ receives divine energy determines the shape of that nation's letters.
The Song of Each Minister: Each ×©×¨ sings a song to Hashemâ€”this song determines how it receives divine energy. Gabriel taught Yosef the seventy languages by teaching him each ×©×¨'s song.
'Opening' = Source: The 'beginning' (×¤×ª×™×—×”) of each nation is its ×©×¨'s connection to holiness. Mordechai could 'open' these gates because he knew each ×©×¨'s song.
Influencing Achashverosh: A tzaddik who knows a nation's spiritual song can influence that nation's ×©×¨. This is how Mordechai compelled Achashverosh to honor the Jews!

blocks.outro: Israel's script (Ktav Ashurit) and language (Lashon HaKodesh) are perfect because we receive directly from Hashem, not through an intermediary. We serve the 'God of gods.'

blocks.text: Why Purim Will Never Be Nullified

blocks.title: An Eternal Holiday
blocks.intro: The Sages teach: 'All festivals are destined to be nullified in the future, except for Purim.' Why should Purim, of all holidays, be eternal?

items.content: Other Holidays' Purpose: Pesach, Shavuot, Sukkot commemorate miracles that changed nature. They remind us that even when the world operates 'naturally,' Hashem controls everything.
The Messianic Era: In the future, nature itself will be rectifiedâ€”'the cow and bear shall graze together.' We won't need miracles that change nature, because nature itself will be holy.
Purim Already Embodies This: The miracle happened within natureâ€”nature itself did God's bidding. This is exactly what the Messianic era will look like. Purim is a preview of the future!

blocks.outro: Purim won't be nullified because its essential qualityâ€”God's presence revealed through nature, not against itâ€”is precisely what will characterize the Messianic age. It already embodies the goal.

items.title: See the 'Reishit' in Everything
items.body: Mordechai saw the 'beginning' within every 'end.' When you look at any created thing, ask: 'Why does this exist? What is its purpose in Hashem's plan?' This contemplation refines the world itself.

items.title: Give Tzedakah with Complete Joy
items.body: Give matanos l'evyonim with absolute simchaâ€”no hesitation, no regret. Your act creates a cascade of divine kindness flowing through all worlds. You're giving delight to angels beyond number.

items.title: Trust That Nature Is Holy
items.body: The 'coincidences' that work in your favor, the subtle providential guidanceâ€”this IS divine intervention. Recognize God working THROUGH nature, just as He did at Purim.

items.title: Letters Matter
items.body: Since letter shapes represent how divine light flows into physicality, the WORDS you use carry real spiritual power. Holy words draw holy light into the world.
